Stem: In a forest ecosystem, oak trees produce their own food through photosynthesis. Caterpillars feed on oak leaves, while spiders capture and eat caterpillars. Robins eat both spiders and caterpillars. Hawks hunt and eat robins. When these organisms die, fungi decompose them and return nutrients to the soil, which the oak trees absorb. Which conclusion about the feeding relationships in this ecosystem is supported by the information?
Choices: A) Hawks are omnivores because they obtain energy from both plant and animal sources in the food web., B) Robins are primary consumers because they mainly obtain energy by eating caterpillars., C) Oak trees function at multiple positions in the food chain because they absorb nutrients processed by decomposers., D) Spiders are secondary consumers because they eat organisms that feed directly on producers. DCI Justification: DCI present but used at surface level — identification rather than reasoning.
